author: Shannon Ryan
title: Grading Illinois' performance vs. Wisconsin
text:
Grading Illinois' performance vs. Wisconsin 
All the action from Memorial Stadium. 
Illinois failed to find answers against Wisconsin on Saturday in a 24-13 homecoming loss that put them in a fourth-place tie in the Big Ten West. 
Offense 
D-. The Badgers stifled almost any semblance of a run game. Save a 36-yard touchdown run by Ke'Shawn Vaughn, the Illini picked up only 19 yards on the ground. Illinois struggled mightily on third-down conversions, going 3-for-12 overall and 0-for-5 on third-and-short situations. 
Defense 
C-. Wisconsin, using a backup quarterback for most of the game, converted 9 of 16 third downs. Illinois did snag two interceptions by Eaton Spence and Clayton Fejedelem. Giving up a 56-yard run to Alex Erickson was a game-changer. 
Special teams 
C. Kicker Taylor Zalewski delivered with two field goals. V'Angelo Bentley was serviceable but didn't have a breakout run. Illinois started six drives at or inside its 20-yard line. 
Coaching 
C. The Illini had a chance to gain some leverage in the Big Ten West against Wisconsin. They even had a lead in the third quarter but lost momentum.
